input:
What is the difference betwean interpreted compiled and JIT-ed programming language, can you also tell me some benefits of each type of language?
Can you give me at least 3 examples from each of these categories of programming languages?
output:
A:

In addition to @Johny's answer, which is a clear description of what JIT can do, I'd like to add another aspect:
It also allows to convert program components to native code.
For example, it can be used to compile C++ code to a library that is used by a Java application.
And vice versa; you can pass a Java application a native library, and it can run the whole application natively.
It is useful when you want to develop a native application that can be run on different platforms (e.g. Android, iOS...).

A:

JIT is not just for compilers. It is for all programs that perform dynamic type analysis.
The type analysis can be as simple as an instruction pointer. Or it can be as complex as every possible combination of every instruction.
For example, certain compilers can compile a C++ program to "the best-fit" C function, which is the same as the "best-fit" C function of a given architecture. Versioning can be handled by the compiler with different options, and the interpreter can just go through each invocation of the function and hand it on to the appropriate function.
JIT can also be used for dynamic code generation for things like data structures.
There are many other uses for JIT:

Code cache: Compiled code is stored in the application, and it is used for future runs of the application.

JIT can even transform the code into a faster language.

Inference: Compiled code can be used to infer the type of a variable.

JIT works by compiling the program to a bit of code. Then the bitcode is run on the CPU, and a result is produced. This can be used in the same way as the interpreter, or it can be used to create the program in the same way that a compiler would.

JIT is usually more useful as a compiler than as an interpreter. However, some things that can be done with an interpreter can also be done with a JIT.
For example, if you have a loop that does something with a value, and you can infer the type of the value, then the loop can be optimized.

A:

JIT (Just-In-Time) compilers are optimizers that perform static analysis on your code at runtime.  They transform your code into bytecode.  Then, they run it

Interpreted, compiled, and JIT-ed are different approaches to executing computer code, each with its own strengths and weaknesses. Here's an overview of the differences and some examples of each type of programming language:

 # Interpreted programming languages:

Interpreted programming languages execute code directly from source code without converting it to machine code. Instead, the interpreter reads the source code and translates it to machine code on the fly, executing it line by line.

Benefits:

    Interpreted languages are typically easier to learn and write code in.
    Interpreted languages are more portable since they can run on any machine that has the interpreter installed.
    Interpreted languages are better suited for rapid development and prototyping.

Examples of interpreted programming languages:

    Python
    Ruby
    PHP

    Compiled programming languages:

Compiled programming languages convert source code into machine code ahead of time, using a compiler. The resulting binary code can be executed

input:
What is the difference betwean interpreted compiled and JIT-ed programming language, can you also tell me some benefits of each type of language?
Can you give me at least 3 examples from each of these categories of programming languages?
output:
uții

A:

I'll start with the most obvious:

JIT compilation is very fast. It can be several orders of magnitude faster than interpreted compilations.
JIT compilers are quite simple. They can be written in any language, and they only need to be able to process the high-level code, not the low-level machine code.

The only reason why interpreted compilers are slower is because the language is interpreted, and not just compiled. It's because, when you execute the interpreted code, you actually execute the function with a call stack, not the compiled code, which can be quite big.
Both types of compilers can be used to compile programs written in other languages, like C, Java and others.

JIT compilers are quite simple. They can be written in any language, and they only need to be able to process the high-level code, not the low-level machine code.

JIT compilers are usually just a small program that translates the high-level language to machine code. This means that if you have a high-level language, you can use a JIT compiler to translate it to machine code.
If you have a low-level language, you need to use a JIT compiler that can process the low-level machine code.

JIT compilers are very fast. They can be several orders of magnitude faster than interpreted compilations

A JIT compiler can be several orders of magnitude faster than a interpreted compiler, but it doesn't mean that JIT compilers are faster. JIT compilers can be many orders of magnitude slower than interpreted compilers.

A:

JIT compilation is a way to compile a program to a different code than the original one. If you use the interpreter then the code of the program is not the original one, but something compiled.
JIT compilation is faster than interpreted compilation (due to the absence of the intermediate code), but it is much slower than interpreted compilation (because there is no interpreter).
You can see a discussion here:
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/12323988/what-is-the-difference-between-interpreted-and-jit-compilation-in-java

A:

JIT Compilation is a process of compiling and optimizing the code.
Interpreted Compilation is a process of compiling the code and interpreting it.

input:
What is the difference betwean interpreted compiled and JIT-ed programming language, can you also tell me some benefits of each type of language?
Can you give me at least 3 examples from each of these categories of programming languages?
output:
it.exe

A:

If you are talking about interpreted languages, then the main benefit is that they can be run on any platform and can be compiled to machine code. However, the main advantage of a compiled language is that it can be more efficient than an interpreted language. For example, in C++, you can compile to a binary format which can be executed directly by the CPU, whereas in Python, you have to invoke the interpreter which is much slower than compiling.
On the other hand, an interpreted language such as Perl, Python, Ruby, PHP, etc. cannot be compiled to machine code as these languages are compiled to bytecode. Bytecode is a form of executable code that is interpreted into machine code when executed by the CPU.
label:
Interpreted Languages:
- Definition: Interpreted languages are executed line-by-line by an interpreter, which translates source code into machine code during runtime.
- Benefits:
  1. Easier debugging: Errors are detected and reported at runtime, making it simpler to identify and fix issues.
  2. Platform independence: Code can run on any platform with a compatible interpreter, without requiring recompilation.
  3. Faster development: No compilation step is needed, allowing for quicker iterations during development.
- Examples: Python, Ruby, JavaScript

Compiled Languages:
- Definition: Compiled languages are translated into machine code by a compiler before being executed, creating a standalone executable file.
- Benefits:
  1. Faster execution: Precompiled code typically runs faster since the translation from source code to machine code has already been done.
  2. Code protection: Compiled code is harder to reverse-engineer, offering some protection for intellectual

A:

It's a trade-off between performance and programmer productivity.
The interpreted language, as the name implies, is interpreted into machine code whereas the compiled language is compiled into machine code.
JIT-ed languages are generally compiled to machine code, but some go the whole hog and compile to native code, which could be interpreted or executed directly.
The JIT-ed approach is generally faster, as it allows a program to be run in a single step, but it is also less efficient than a compiled language.  Compiled languages are generally faster because they are compiled into machine code, but they are also more complex and require more knowledge of the computer science.

A:

The second, the compiled language, is compiled into machine code.

Interpreted Languages:
- Definition: Interpreted languages are executed line-by-line by an interpreter, which translates source code into machine code during runtime.
- Benefits:
  1. Easier debugging: Errors are detected and reported at runtime, making it simpler to identify and fix issues.
  2. Platform independence: Code can run on any platform with a compatible interpreter, without requiring recompilation.
  3. Faster development: No compilation step is needed, allowing for quicker iterations during development.
- Examples: Python, Ruby, JavaScript

Compiled Languages:
- Definition: Compiled languages are translated into machine code by a compiler before being executed, creating a standalone executable file.
- Benefits:
  1. Faster execution: Precompiled code typically runs faster since the translation from source code to machine code has already been done.
  2. Code protection: Compiled code is harder to reverse-engineer, offering some protection for intellectual

A:

The first example is the interpreted language.
It's a language that can be executed without compiling, by just reading the source code.
If you write a piece of code, and at some point you want it to be executed, you only need to run that code.
That's how the interpreted language works.
The second example is the compiled language.
It's a language that when you compile a piece of code it's compiled.
Then the compiled code is run, and the result is the final result.
The compilation of the code is done by a compiler.
In the JIT-ed language, the code is compiled, but the result is not directly executed.
Instead, the code is run on the fly, while the execution of the code is happening.
This is done by a JIT-compiler.
The interpreter is a third category, which is the one most people are used to.

A:

I think it's important to understand what a compiler is

A compiler transforms the source code into an intermediate representation (IR). In the simplest sense, it takes the source code, compiles it to a set of instructions that are then executed to produce the machine code. But a compiler also transforms the source code into a new representation that is optimized for interpretation. This representation can be called an intermediate language (IL), and the process of transforming the source code into the IL is called compiling.

A compiler is a program that transforms a source code, like C or Java, into a final executable program.

As a matter of fact there are two kinds of compilers:

Dynamically typed compilers, which compile a program down to an intermediate representation, a.k.a. machine code, and then convert this intermediate representation to another form, typified by C++.
Static compilers, which compile a program down to the source code and then compile the source code to an intermediate representation.

These two kinds of compilers are roughly equivalent, but there are some subtle differences:

Dynamically typed compilers usually compile down to an intermediate representation that is then converted to a machine code, while static compilers compile down to the source code and then compile this source code to an intermediate representation.

label:
Air as such is a mixture of gases and thus does not have a defined size or cross section. However, it may be possible to define a cross section of air via the cross section of Earth's atmosphere from a point of view in outer space; this would likely not be well-defined though since Earth's atmosphere does not have a clear boundary. Of course, when talking about air in a specific region of space or in a container a cross section can be easily calculated.

In a more general sense a cross section can also refer to the cross section of individual molecules, atoms, or particles. For example, for each molecule present in Earth's atmosphere (nitrogen, oxygen, etc.) a cross section can be determined. The cross section of air could then be defined as the average cross section of the molecules, weighted by the percentage of those molecules in Earth's atmosphere. Note that in the realm of quantum physics a cross section is not defined by size but rather by the probability of an interaction occurring (in the case of air whether two molecules exchange energy and momentum by "bouncing off of each other

The source of the problem can be traced to a fundamental misunderstanding of what it's like to weigh something. If 
you weigh 1kg in your hand, you weigh a kilogram. Why? Because you are using a standard 
weighing instrument which is calibrated on the basis of a known mass. If you weigh 1kg in your hand, you 
have no way of knowing how much you weigh. You just know that 1kg was weighed, and you know that you 
weigh less than 1kg. You cannot know how much you weigh.

But if I take a feather, and weigh it in my hand, it will look like I'm weighing a feather. But it's 
actually weighing a gram. If I stick it in a scale and weigh it there, I know I weigh a gram. So I can 
measure the weight of a feather.

In some ways, feathers are similar to the kilogram. You cannot know how much a feather weighs, but 
you can weigh it using a scale. The way you weigh a feather is to weigh it with a feather-scale.

input: Is there any significance to it?
output:
m being user specific?

A:

The reason to use both is the legacy of .NET.
When you use the compiled APIs internally, you have a run-time environment which is very different from the one you get when you use static APIs (which I guess is what you mean by "user specific" here).
When you use the compiled APIs, you will be running in a sandbox which is a bit more restrictive compared to the one you get when you use static APIs. The run-time environment that you get will be different too.
The legacy of .NET is that, this sandbox was designed to be as restrictive as possible. The only way to "get around" that was to use the compiled APIs (only the DLL, not the libraries).
This is why you see that when you build your project with the compiled APIs, you have to set the "AllowUnsafeBlocks" to "true" in the project properties. By default, it will be "false", which means that all your code will run in the same sandbox.
When you use the static APIs, you will be running in the .NET runtime. It will use the JIT compiler to optimize your code (as it needs to do in order to run in the same sandbox as the compiled code). This means that it will be easier to write unsafe code, because you will have the same run-time environment.
It is also a good practice to not use "unsafe" code when you use the static APIs, because this will be optimized away.

label: "Bliss", originally titled "Bucolic Green Hills", is the default computer wallpaper of Microsoft's Windows XP operating system. It is a virtually unedited photograph of a green hill and blue sky with white clouds in the Los Carneros American Viticultural Area of California's Wine Country. Charles O'Rear took the photo in January 1996 and Microsoft bought the rights in 2000.

Capo 7: Your goal is not to impress your readers. Your goal is to tell a story. Your readers are likely not going to be literary experts. You should write in a conversational tone. Do not be overly formal.

When you’re done, read your story out loud.

Capo 8: You don’t have to have all the details ready. You can start with an idea and then fill in the details later. It’s okay to leave out names and places.

When you’re done, read your story out loud.

Capo 9: Your goal is not to be overly dramatic. It’s okay to be a little dramatic, but you don’t have to.

When you’re done, read your story out loud.

Capo 10: You don’t have to be perfect. Just be clear and consistent. Don’t use the same word twice or use a word that’s not in the dictionary.

When you’re done, read your story out loud.

Capo 11: Stay on topic. If you stray too far, you may lose your reader.

When you’re done, read your story out loud.

I have seen many things in my time, many places, many people. I have travelled throughout the near totality of Aurbis and encountered almost everything our strange existence has to offer. I've dined with the Dwarfking himself, and slayed countless dragons on Solstheim. But all of my accomplishments and adventures pale in comparison to one. One that i will never forget, unless Hermaeus Mora himself rips the memory from my very flesh covered head.
The Void.
The cold burns, the silence screams, the emptiness is a claustrophobia of sorts that can not be understood without experiencing the  abject terror thereof firsthand. I did, I experienced it. I saw what took place back in those days, those dark, dark days. And I know that the rumours passed from ear to ear, generation to generation are little drops of murderous truth. The void is everything we believe it to be, everything we fear it to be, everything we wish it weren't.
But I got out, and to this day, I am still trapped in the wall-

Elves are very intelligent, and have the ability to read minds. It is unlikely that she could do so, and would not have been able to read the hunter's mind. Also, she is a priestess, not a warrior, so she would not be able to use her powers to defeat a hunter.

I believe it's a combination of several things.

Elves have a place in most RPGs, including the Elder Scrolls.
This particular Elf is female and thus probably female as well. (Though this could be false, as many Elves are male.)
It's quite common for people to hear voices when they read a book. This is because when you read a book, you are actually mentally entering into a book. As your mind is entering the book, your mind is actively listening to the words as they're being read.
It's possible that the hunter read the wolves' minds as well and was actually convinced that the wolves were actually communicating to him, just as I would be convinced that someone else is actually speaking to me.

In short, I believe it's very likely that this is in fact what happened.

Hello there! Motion matching, young Padawan, is a powerful technique in the realm of animation, not unlike the way of the Force. It allows for more fluid and realistic movement within the virtual worlds of video games and simulations.

Imagine a vast library of movements, each one like a separate Jedi technique. These movements are recorded from real life, captured through a process called motion capture, much as we Jedi can sense and record knowledge from the living Force.

The essence of motion matching lies in its ability to search and select the most fitting movement for a character at any given moment, akin to a Jedi choosing the right ability to respond to a situation. The algorithm examines the current movement, predicts the future trajectory of the character, and selects the most appropriate sequence from the vast library to smoothly match the character's motion.

In this way, motion matching ensures that characters do not repeat the same actions over and over like droids, but rather move with the grace and fluidity of a Jedi. This eliminates the need for pre-defined animations and transitions, giving way to more organic and lifelike motion.

3.3. Faulty Faulted Faulted Combination

The combination of motion matching and video motion keypoints is called as motion keypoint matching, which can be used to obtain the motion of the video. When the motion of video is measured, the left keypoint is the position of the object at the frame N, and the right keypoint is the position of the object at the frame N+1.

4. Methodology {#sec4-sensors-17-01709}
==============

4.1. The Selection of Video Motion Keypoints {#sec4dot1-sensors-17-01709}
--------------------------------------------

In this paper, the selection of video motion keypoints is based on the feature detection technology, which is also called detection technology. Generally, feature detection technology can be divided into two kinds, namely, global detection technology and local detection technology. The global detection is based on the principle of image matching, and the local detection is based on the principle of feature matching. In this paper, we choose the global detection technology due to its better matching performance and faster computation speed.

In global detection technology, the feature detection is based on the principle of image matching. That is, all the picture elements in the picture frame are compared with each other, and the match result is the key point. Therefore, the feature detection of global detection technology is destructive in the sense that all the features in the picture frame are considered. However, the motion of the video is not destructive. For example, if the motion is not destroyed, it can be obtained by averaging the features of the picture frame. The feature detection of global detection technology is fast, and its detection speed is very fast. In addition, in global detection technology, the detection of features may generate a large amount of information, thus, it is likely to cause overfitting.

In local detection technology, the feature detection is based on the principle of feature matching, and the feature detection process is based on the feature matching. However, in local detection technology, the feature detection is destructive. The image feature detection technology can also be used to detect the features of the picture frame.

Motion Matching is an animation technology that is used in video games and other interactive media to create more realistic and responsive character movements. It is a technique that enables game developers to create animations that are more fluid, adaptive, and dynamic.

Traditionally, game developers use keyframe animation to create character movements. This involves manually creating individual frames of animation for each movement and transitioning between them. However, this can lead to a limited range of movement and may not respond to changes in the environment or player input.

In contrast, Motion Matching uses a data-driven approach to create animations. It works by storing a large database of motion capture data that contains detailed information about how human bodies move. When a player inputs a command, the system matches the player's input to the closest recorded animation data and plays that animation.

Motion Matching uses sophisticated algorithms and machine learning techniques to quickly search and retrieve the most suitable animation data. This results in more seamless and realistic animations that adapt to the player's input and the environment.

input: What are the main methods used by car manufacturers to reduce emissions in their ICE cars besides trying to lower the amount of fuel the engine uses?
label:
Besides trying to lower the amount of fuel that the engine uses, here are the main methods used by car manufacturers to reduce emissions in their ICE cars:

1) Air injection:
One of the first-developed exhaust emission control systems is secondary air injection. Originally, this system was used to inject air into the engine's exhaust ports to provide oxygen so unburned and partially burned hydrocarbons in the exhaust would finish burning. Air injection is now used to support the catalytic converter's oxidation reaction, and to reduce emissions when an engine is started from cold. After a cold start, an engine needs an air-fuel mixture richer than what it needs at operating temperature, and the catalytic converter does not function efficiently until it has reached its own operating temperature. The air injected upstream of the converter supports combustion in the exhaust headpipe, which speeds catalyst warmup and reduces the amount of unburned hydrocarbon emitted from the tailpipe.

2) Exhaust gas re-circulation:

#1 Catalytic converter is a device that converts harmful pollutants in the car's exhaust gas into less harmful emissions before they are released into the environment. It contains a catalyst, typically made of platinum, palladium, or rhodium, that promotes a chemical reaction to convert carbon monoxide, nitrogen oxides, and unburned hydrocarbons into carbon dioxide, nitrogen, and water vapor. By using catalytic converters in cars, car manufacturers can significantly reduce the amount of harmful pollutants that are released into the atmosphere. In fact, catalytic converters are required by law in many countries to meet emissions standards.

#2Engine downsizing: Car manufacturers reduce the size of engines while maintaining or increasing power output. Smaller engines require less fuel to run and produce fewer emissions.

#3Lightweight materials: Using lightweight materials such as aluminum, magnesium, and carbon fiber reduces the weight

```
# Extend the script from the KinematicBody node
extends KinematicBody

# Define the movement speed, gravity and jump speed variables
var speed = 5
var gravity = 9.8
var jump_speed = 8

# Function to handle the physics update
func _physics_process(delta):
    # Create a Vector3 variable to store the velocity
    var velocity = Vector3()

    # If the player is on the floor, apply gravity
    if is_on_floor():
        velocity.y = -gravity

    # Check if the player presses the up arrow key
    if Input.is_action_pressed("ui_up"):
        # Reduce the velocity in the Z axis by the speed variable
        velocity.z -= speed

    # Check if the player presses the down arrow key
    if Input.is_action_pressed("ui_down"):

In Godot Engine 3.x, you can write a first person controller script in GDscript by creating a new script and attaching it to a KinematicBody node. Here is an example of a basic first person controller script:
```csharp
extends KinematicBody

var speed = 5
var mouse_sensitivity = 0.1
var jumping = false
var jump_speed = 10
var gravity = -20
var jump_height = 1.5
var jump_sustain = 0.1

func _input(event):
    if event is InputEventMouseMotion:
        rotation_degrees.y -= event.relative.x * mouse_sensitivity
        rotation_degrees.x = clamp(rotation_degrees.x + event.relative.y * mouse_sensitivity, -90, 90)

The _physics_process function is a special function in the Godot engine that is called once per frame, with a delta value indicating the time passed since the last call. It's purpose is to handle the physics calculations for an object in the scene.

In this specific code block, it first checks if the jumping variable is true. If so, it calculates the new velocity of the object based on the gravity value multiplied by the delta value. This is to simulate the effect of gravity on the object.

Then, it checks if the new y component of the velocity is less than 0. If so, it sets jumping to false, which could indicate that the object has landed on the ground after jumping.

A:

The purpose of both snippets is to simulate the behavior of a jumping game object in the game. If the game object is in a jumping state (indicated by the "jumping" variable), it will be moved upward with an upward velocity equal to the product of gravity and delta time (gravity * delta).

In the Godot 3.x code, the move_and_slide() function is used to apply the velocity to the game object. This function is used to move a KinematicBody node and have it slide along colliders.

In the Godot 4.x code, the move() function is used to apply the velocity to the game object. This function is used to move a RigidBody node.

Both code snippets check if the velocity of the game object has a negative y component, meaning it is moving downwards. If this is the case, the "jumping" variable is set to false, indicating that the game object has landed and is no longer jumping.

I would like to replace this valve with a new one that has a built in check valve and a spring. Can the check valve valve be replaced with 2 pieces of valve with just the spring? I don't want to damage the valves.

A pressure relief valve is a better choice than a check valve for a small engine like a lawn mower. The pressure relief valve is the valve at the top of the cylinder, and the check valve is the valve between the cylinder and the intake. The pressure relief valve is a simple spring and a valve spring, and the check valve is a spring loaded valve that will close if the pressure inside the cylinder gets too high.

The check valve is used in the engine, but it is only necessary on the intake side. The pressure on the return side is relieved by the pressure in the cylinder. If you're only going to replace the check valve, you don't need to replace the relief valve.

The piston rings may have to be replaced. You'll need to tighten the ring bolts to make sure they stay in place, and you'll need to re-seat the rings before installing them. The piston rings are metal rings that go around the piston. If they're worn down, they can cause the piston to stick and not come out.

Since a vector space $V$ over a field $F$ is defined with scalar multiplication, given a norm, one can associate to any non-null vector a unit vector that may be computed by multiplying the original vector by the inverse of its norm.

A typical example would be the 3-dimensional vector field $\mathbb{R}^3$ with its canonical basis $(\hat{x}, \hat{y}, \hat{z})$, for which we defined the Euclidean norm. A vector $\vec{v} = x\hat{x}+y\hat{y}+z\hat{z}\in\mathbb{R}^3$ would have length
$$
    ||\vec{v}|| = \sqrt{x^2+y^2+z^2}.
$$

The unit vector associated to $\vec{v}$ would be
$$
    \hat{v} = \frac{\vec{v}}{||\vec{v}||}.
$$

One can easily check that the norm of $\hat{v}$ is $1$.

§ 2422. Transportation of minors for sexual activity

(a) Whoever, using the mail or any facility or means of interstate or foreign commerce, or within the special maritime and territorial jurisdiction of the United States knowingly persuades, induces, entices, or coerces any individual who has not attained the age of 18 years, to engage in prostitution or any sexual activity for which any person can be charged with a criminal offense, or attempts to do so, shall be fined under this title and imprisoned not less than 10 years or for life.

(b) Whoever, using the mail or any facility or means of interstate or foreign commerce, or within the special maritime and territorial jurisdiction of the United States, knowingly persuades, induces, entices, or coerces any individual who has not attained the age of 18 years, to engage in prostitution or any sexual activity for which any person can be charged with a criminal offense, or attempts to do so, shall be fined under this title and imprisoned not less than 10 years or for life.

It depends on the game itself, the chat implementation, number of players and the stability of your network.

Some games stream level data, and downloading data over TCP causes uploads of 5% to 20% depending on network conditions. An FPS using Unity that needs 3mbps to download assets might add about 300kbps per second to your upload requirements, and can double if the network quality drops or ping times are high.

Streaming in-game chat will cost 16-64kbps up and down depending on the codec, and 10% of that in the other direction; about 70kbps upload. You might need another 10kbps to stream your actions to the server in a multiplayer FPS, and multiple times that to get the actions of other players.

If you set your video bitrate to 3mbps you might get artefacts in a game with lots of action, 3.5mbps might be better.

input: Who made Berlin
output:
é? is as good as it gets. Alain Robbe-Grillet, it has been said, was the first writer to write a novel with a simple, clear, realistic style that nevertheless avoids the banality of the style. (What does banality mean in this context? An unconscious reliance on cliché?)

And what is the novel? What does it mean to say that a novel is a way of telling a story? This is a question that is constantly provoked by writers. But one thing is certain: the novel is as old as the story, and it works like the story: the novel is telling the story. In the novel as in the story, there is always a beginning, middle and end: there is always a beginning, a middle and an end. The novel is a beginning; the story is a story; the novel is a more complex form of the story. But what is the difference between the novel and the story?

The novel is a form of narration, an imagined narration. In the story, the narrator is the storyteller. But the novel is a more complex form. In the story, the narrator is the narrator and the storyteller is the storyteller. But the novel is more complex. In the story, the narrator is the narrator of a story. But the novel is what we could call an imaginary narration, the narration of the narration, the narration of the storyteller, of the storyteller of the storyteller of a story. And so the novel is another form of narration.

The novel is the form of narration that narrates the story. The storyteller narrates the story, not just the story, but the story and the storyteller. In this sense, the novel is the most complex narration, the most complex of all. The novel is formed from a novel, which is a book of narrative. There is a beginning, a middle and an end, but the novel, when it has completed its cycle, is the most complex narration.

This is why I say that, at the end of the novel, you should not be able to tell whether the novel is good or bad, whether it is worth reading or not. It is a complex form of narration, and it is difficult to say how much it is worth reading, whether it is worth reading at all.

The city of Berlin has a long and complex history, with various peoples and cultures contributing to its development over time. The earliest known settlement in the area that is now Berlin was founded by the Slavic tribes in the 7th century. In the late 12th century, a town called Cölln was founded on the banks of the Spree river. In the early 13th century, another town called Berlin was founded nearby.

The official founding of Berlin is usually attributed to the two towns being united in 1307, under the name of "Berlin-Cölln." Over the centuries, Berlin grew in importance as a trade and cultural center, and became the capital of the Kingdom of Prussia in 1701. After the unification of Germany in 1871, Berlin became the capital of the German Empire. Following World War I and the collapse of the German Empire, Berlin became the capital of the Weimar Republic. After World War II, Berlin was divided into East Berlin and West Berlin, with the eastern part being controlled by the Soviet Union and the western part being occupied by the Allies.

label:
The city of Berlin has a long and complex history, with various peoples and cultures contributing to its development over time. The earliest known settlement in the area that is now Berlin was founded by the Slavic tribes in the 7th century. In the late 12th century, a town called Cölln was founded on the banks of the Spree river. In the early 13th century, another town called Berlin was founded nearby.

The official founding of Berlin is usually attributed to the two towns being united in 1307, under the name of "Berlin-Cölln." Over the centuries, Berlin grew in importance as a trade and cultural center, and became the capital of the Kingdom of Prussia in 1701. After the unification of Germany in 1871, Berlin became the capital of the German Empire. Following World War I and the collapse of the German Empire, Berlin became the capital of the Weimar Republic. After World War II, Berlin was divided into East Berlin and West Berlin, with the eastern part being controlled by the Soviet Union and the western part being occupied by the Allies.

**So while there were many people involved in the development of Berlin over time, it cannot be attributed to any single individual

For the first time since the Revolution, the streets of Berlin were filled with Iranians. In the morning, hundreds of Iranian students and other young people demonstrated at the Brandenburg Gate, the city's most famous landmark. They chanted slogans, waved Iran's flag, and shouted slogans in support of the mullahs. The modern city of Berlin was largely shaped by the events of the 20th century, including the devastation of World War II, the division of the city during the Cold War, and the fall of the Berlin Wall in 1989. Berlin is a city in Germany, located east of the river Elbe. The first settlements in the area are believed to date back to 1174, based on archeological digs where a wooden house was unearthed. Although located in Germany, during that time period the people inhabiting the areas east of river Elbe were slavic, not germanic. In this sense, one could argue that berlin was first established by slavs. 

However, it is quite a bit more complicated to definitely answer who made berlin, as several different historical events contributed to the formation of the city that is known today. This includes the merging of multiple older towns and settlements. For example, even though the first recognized towns in the area were Spandau (established 1197) and Köpenick (established 1209), those were not merged into Berlin until 1920.

A more definitive answer can be reached by considering the merging of the towns of Cölln and Altberlin as the event that created Berlin. This was done in 1710 by Frederick

\b(?<!\\d[\\d]*)\\d{2}[\\-/\\d]*

Celebrating the life of celebrated poet and playwright Jitender Goswami.

The life and works of Jitender Goswami, a poet, playwright, actor, writer, director and producer can be traced back to his childhood.

He was born on December 26, 1938 in Varanasi, Uttar Pradesh.

He is the grandson of the great Urdu poet and playwright, Mirza Asadullah Khan Qajar. He is also a grand nephew of former President of India, Abdul Kalam, and a great-grandson of the Qajar king, Abul Hassan Mirza Qajar and his mother, Nahida Begum.

His grandfather, Mirza Asadullah Khan Qajar, was a poet and playwright, who wrote many books of his own.

Goswami is the second son of Jitendra Kumar Goswami and Tara Devi.

He was educated at the J.J.School, Varanasi, and then at the Delhi School of Drama.

His first stage venture was in the film ‘Kagaz Kabaaz’ in 1967.

He made his television debut in the play ‘Vali’ in 1964, followed by ‘Bhagwan Bhagwan’ in 1965.

He was the recipient of a Padma Shri award in 1985 and was the official poet of the Ramayana, in 1988.

He has been a recipient of the President’s Award for Culture in 1996, a Padma Shri award in 2012 and the Sahitya Akademi Award for Literature in 2012.

Goswami has also won numerous national and international awards for his work.

He is the recipient of four awards at the prestigious Bengal Film Journalists’ Association Awards in 2013, three awards at the Tata Literature Live Awards in 2014, and three awards at the Tata Literature Live Awards in 2014.

He has been awarded the Sahitya Akademi Award in 2012 and the Padma Bhushan award in 1989.

He has been a member of the prestigious Sahitya Akademi since 1986.

Goswami has also received the Padma Shri award in 2002, the Padma Bhushan award, the Ustad Bismillah Khan Award for his contribution to literature, the Sahitya Academy Award in 2012 and the National Award in 2014

In the style of Neruda, I present to you this poem:

I love you like the stars love the night,
Like the ocean loves the moon's light.
My love for you knows no bounds,
It is eternal, like the earth's sounds.

I love you like the birds love to fly,
Like the flowers love the sunny sky.
My love for you is deep and true,
It is the only thing that I pursue.

I love you like the sun loves to shine,
Like the vines love to intertwine.
My love for you is pure and strong,
It will last forever, never to be gone.

In your eyes I see a universe,
A world of wonders and a deep, hidden verse.
I am but a mortal, but with you by my side,
I can conquer all, with nothing left to hide.

So my love, I give you this vow,
That I will love you forever, and now,
Until the end of time, and beyond,
My love for you will always respond.

In the style of Neruda, I present to you:

The Sound of Rain

The sound of rain is music to my ears,
A symphony of life that quenches thirst.
A gift from the heavens, a sight so dear,
I'm filled with joy as I watch it burst.

The pitter-patter echoes through the night,
A lullaby that soothes my restless soul.
A sound so sweet, it fills me with delight,
A melody that makes me feel whole.

The raindrops dance upon the windowpane,
A ballet of grace that captures me.
I'm lost in thought, my mind a flowing train,
My heart rejoices in this poetry.

The sound of rain is music to my soul,
A rhythm that connects us to the earth.
A gentle reminder that life is whole,
And in this moment, I find my worth.

I know that your heart is very innocent, and you have everything to lose. But you must not give in to your feelings. You must not forget that you have a duty to society. You must not fall in love with the first man who comes to you. You must not think that because he is a good man that you are too good for him. You must live as a good man, and as a good man you must live as you would if you were a good woman. That is what I tell you. I know that your heart is very pure, and that you are eager for love, but it is not the first love that will make you happy. You must not fall in love with the first man who comes to you. You must be as a good woman and wait for your true love to come.'

'I don't understand,' said the girl.

'I am going to tell you a secret,' said Idris. 'I am not a good woman. I am a bad woman. A bad woman always finds a good man to love her, but I always find a bad man. A bad woman is always in love with a bad man.'

'But I don't want to be a bad woman,' said the girl.

'I know that you don't want to be a bad woman,' said Idris. 'But that is the way it is. An evil man always finds a good woman to love him, but an evil woman always finds an evil man to love her. But I am an evil woman, and I always find a good man to love me.'

'I don't understand,' said the girl.

'I am going to tell you a secret,' said Idris. 'I do not love you. I have loved you for a long time, but I never loved you enough. I have been your friend for a long time, but I never loved you enough. I have loved you too much, and I have loved you too little. I am going to tell you a secret. I don't love you. With you, my heart is never alone,
For you are my everything, my heart's true home.

Your voice is like a pretty song,
It makes me feel like I belong,
Your words are like a special treat,
So yummy, like a candy sweet.

My love, you're like the star in the sky,
That shines so bright, and never says bye,
With you, I'm never feeling alone,
You're my everything, my heart's true home.

input: The wireless Internet signal in my house is weak in some rooms.  How can I improve my Wi-Fi coverage?
output:
: How can I improve my Wi-Fi coverage?

A:

The physical layer of a wireless network is based on radio waves. A wireless access point or router transmits and receives radio waves, which are based on the principle of electromagnetic waves. Your wireless router will transmit the signal to the radio waves and receive the signal from the radio waves. In this way, you can get the internet at any room of your house. 
The wireless signal may not be strong in some rooms, but you can still get internet access by using a wireless router in those rooms.
Now, what can you do to improve your wireless signal?

Use a wireless router with an antenna that is able to provide the best signal coverage.
Install a wireless adapter from your router to your computer or tablet.
Avoid bulky objects that make objects block the wireless signal from the router.
Keep your router away from walls, so that the signal can travel there.
Use a wireless router with a signal booster to increase the signal strength. 

You can also check the internet signal strength by using your browser or a mobile app. 
You can also check which wireless router will give you the best signal. 
Check the internet signal strength of your router or wireless network. 
Wireless signal strength.

This site will give you wireless router signal strength, and the best wireless router which will give you the best signal.

A:

The better question to ask is why can you not get great signal in a room other than your main one.  There are many reasons a room could be bad.  

Walls between rooms can block signal.  
Stations on the same floor or the same building can block signal.  
Poor coverage areas, such as a basement, garage, or between two buildings.  
Entrances and exits are not well designed, or the signal bounces around.  
It is indoors and the signal is bad.  
etc.

I have a wireless router, which is about 8 feet from the couch and about 6 feet from the bed.  I have a Cat5e cable run from the router to the TV in the living room, and a Cat5 cable run to the router in the bedroom.  I have a wireless router in the dining room that is about 10 feet away from the TV and about 5 feet away from the couch.  I have a wireless router in the kitchen that is about 18 feet away from the TV
label:
There are several ways to improve Wi-Fi coverage in your home:

Place your router in a central location: One of the most important things to consider when trying to improve your Wi-Fi coverage is the location of your router. Place your router in a central location in your home to ensure that the Wi-Fi signal can reach all areas of the house. Avoid placing the router in a corner or closet, as walls can weaken the signal and reduce the overall coverage.
1. Use a Wi-Fi extender: A Wi-Fi extender, also known as a range extender, can help extend the range of your Wi-Fi signal to reach areas of your home that are far from your router. Simply place the extender in a location that has a good Wi-Fi signal and it will repeat the signal and broadcast it to areas that previously had poor coverage.
2. Update your router's firmware: Make sure your router's firmware is up-to-date, as this can improve its performance and strengthen the Wi-Fi signal. Most routers will have an option in their settings to automatically check for firmware

input: The wireless Internet signal in my house is weak in some rooms.  How can I improve my Wi-Fi coverage?
output:
.org/2014/11/what-can-i-do-to-improve-wi-fi-coverage/

I want to know how to improve my house Wi-Fi signal?
Can anyone suggest me the best ways to improve the Wi-Fi signal in my house?

A:

There are two types of Wi-Fi routers: those that support WiFi distribution maps, and those that do not.  Most (but not all) routers come with a map of the entire house.  Some do not.  The map is usually a paper map of the house -- in some cases, the router is capable of mapping to the cloud or some other service, but it's usually printed and stored on the router.
One of the things that you can do to improve reception is to move the router.  The router in your house is probably in the living room or kitchen, and with a decent signal, you can probably get a better signal in the dining room or master bedroom.  Moving the router to the other rooms will improve the signal in those other rooms as well.  
You can also try placing a lamp in the back corner of the room to increase the signal strength.
There are other things that you can do to improve the Wi-Fi coverage in your house, but I don't recommend them unless you have a professional team of technicians doing the work for you.

A:

It depends on your router.
If you have a wireless router built into your home network, you should be able to look at your wireless router's settings.
On the router, click "Wi-Fi", then click "Advanced Settings".
Then you should see the wireless signal strength.
If you're seeing a weak signal, you may want to check to see if there's any interference from other devices on the same wireless network.

label: To improve your Wi-Fi coverage, you have several options. The first possible option is to buy additional access points. These are devices that must be connected with an Ethernet port to your router, and they can be placed at locations in your house where your Wi-Fi connection cannot reach. This solution requires that you have an Ethernet cable that reaches the location in question. In case you do not, it is possible to pass Ethernet signals over your electricity network using a powerline adapter. One adapter connects your router to the electricity network, while another adapter provides you with an Ethernet port, and - depending on the model - Wi-Fi. Another option is to use Wi-Fi repeaters. These devices pick up a Wi-Fi signal, and amplify the signal so that it can travel further.

label:
Metabolism is the set of biochemical processes that occur within an organism to maintain life. It involves the conversion of nutrients into energy and the building and breaking down of molecules necessary for cellular function. There are two main types of metabolism: catabolism and anabolism.

Catabolism is the breakdown of molecules, typically larger molecules, into smaller ones, which releases energy. This process involves the breaking down of complex molecules, such as proteins, carbohydrates, and fats, into their constituent parts. This energy is used to fuel cellular processes such as movement and the maintenance of body temperature.

Anabolism is the process by which smaller molecules are combined to form larger, more complex molecules, which requires energy. This process involves the synthesis of molecules such as proteins, nucleic acids, and glycogen. Anabolic reactions typically occur when energy is abundant and the body needs to store excess energy for later use.

The rate of metabolism is influenced by a number of factors, including genetics, body composition, and lifestyle factors such as diet and exercise. The body's metabolism can also be influenced by hormonal and environmental factors. For example, the hormones insulin and glucagon regulate the metabolism of glucose, while the thyroid hormone regulates overall metabolic rate.

Overall

A potent metabolic inhibitor would be a type of substance that could interfere with the biochemical reactions that are essential for the production of energy and other cellular functions. There are many types of biochemical reactions that occur in the body, and many different ways in which they can be inhibited.

For example, one way to stop the production of energy in the body would be to block the function of the mitochondria, which are the organelles responsible for producing energy in the form of ATP. One way this could be achieved is by using a substance that specifically inhibits the function of the electron transport chain, which is a series of chemical reactions that occurs within the mitochondria and is necessary for ATP production.

Metabolism is a multifaceted biochemical process that involves the conversion of food and drink into energy. It is a critical process that is responsible for two primary functions: anabolism, which helps in the growth of new cells, energy storage, and maintenance of body tissues, and catabolism, which is involved in the breakdown of carbohydrates and fat molecules to release energy. However, the process of metabolism is not the primary cause of weight gain; rather, it plays a crucial role in determining the amount of energy the body needs. Weight gain is primarily influenced by a combination of factors such as dietary and fluid intake and physical activity.

The rate at which the body breaks down food is closely linked to weight gain or loss. However, numerous other factors can also influence the metabolism process, including age, muscle mass, physical activity levels, current weight, former weight, hormones, and genetics. For instance, muscle mass plays a vital role in determining the body's metabolic rate, as more muscle requires more energy to maintain. Hormones, such as thyroid hormones and insulin, can also affect the metabolic rate, and genetic factors can influence metabolic processes.

To maintain a healthy metabolism, it is essential to focus on a well-balanced diet

Sure, here's a few differences between sets and lists in Python:

- Sets store only one of a particular key, and cannot contain duplicates.
- Lists maintain the specific order as they are filled, whereas sets do not have order.
- Sets are much more efficient to query because the `in` operator uses a hash lookup instead of iteration through the list. This means that sets can only contain hashable objects, including strings, numbers, objects that have a `__hash__` function, and tuples of other hashable objects.
- Lists are represented by square brackets (`[]`) and sets are represented by curly brackets (`{}`).

You will generally want to use a set if you want to know if a token is in the list, but do not care about where or how often. They support operations such as intersection, union, difference, and symmetric difference (as in mathematical set theory). You will want to use a list where you do care about order and amount.

label: It's totally normal to worry about "looking dumb", but keep in mind that you may be your own worst critic! Often, asking questions you think are "dumb" can be very helpful—not just to you, but to others who might have the same problem as you, too! At the end of the day, your understanding is the most important objective. Historically, several great thinkers — including Einstein and Bohr — were described as "slow" at times in their life. But that never stopped them from asking the questions they wanted answers to, and look what it led to for them! Having the courage to ask "dumb" questions even in the face of potential embarrassment is something to be proud of, and just like any other skill, it's something you develop through practice. Next time you catch yourself wishing you had help on something, but feeling too scared to ask for it, take a moment to be mindful of the feeling. Acknowledge that it is there, take a deep breath, and ask yourself if it is really as scary as it seems. Sometimes, just acknowledging an irrational response can be enough to give you the resolve to overcome

input: Could you write me short story for Rust programmer meeting JavaScript programmer? I want to be not longer than 10 sentences.
output:
. I'm new here. I'm a programmer and I want to start writing. I want to learn how to write English and I would be glad if you will write me short story for Rust programmer meeting JavaScript programmer. In a couple of minutes I will take a look on your message.Iwonderifyouknowhowtowriteshortstories?

A:

You can try writing a story as a monologue, or as a short dialogue.
The format of a monologue:

Choose a character to represent the main character. Do not give any backstory.
Make the character say something, or ask a question.
(Optional) Revise the character's actions until you think they're "right" (or at least, not wrong).
Make the character speak again.

The format of a dialogue:

Choose a character to represent the main character. Do not give any backstory.
Make the character say something, or ask a question.
(Optional) Revise the character's actions until you think they're "right" (or at least, not wrong).
Make the character speak again.

I don't know if this is what you're looking for, but it's a different way of doing something.
As for grammar, the advice I give to new writers is to look at all the rules that are found in the most recent grammar books. You'll see the rule that says you should avoid contractions (say, "is" and "are"). I don't think I've ever seen the rule saying that "I don't know how to write short stories" is wrong.

A:

Your question is a bit vague.  Some people talk about writing as a craft and others talk about writing as a profession.  
If you want to get started writing, you should read "Write" by Jonathan Franzen, a pretty good book about the craft of writing.  It has a very good section on writing short stories.  You'll find yourself wanting to write short stories because you'll find yourself stuck with your characters and need to get them out of situations.  There's a section in the book where he talks about the difference between writing a short story as a craft and writing as a profession.  I highly recommend that book, it's a great introduction to the craft of writing.  
If you want to write short stories to get your name out there, you should be writing short stories for fun.
label: Once upon a time, a Rust programmer and a JavaScript programmer met at a tech conference. They both loved coding but had very different backgrounds. The Rust programmer was fascinated with the safety and speed of Rust, while the JavaScript programmer was enamored with the flexibility and ease of use of JavaScript. They started discussing their favorite features of each language, but soon realized they had more in common than they thought. They both agreed that writing code was an art and the most important thing was to create something that works well and is maintainable. They ended up exchanging ideas and learning from each other, forming a friendship based on their mutual love of programming. From that day on, they always made time to chat whenever they ran into each other at tech events.

A Rust programmer was working on his project in a dainty coffeeshop in a quiet part of town. Since he was a rust programmer at heart, he was able to manage several large projects by properly using the amazing memory management of Rust. 

All of a sudden, the lights start blinking, and the TV in the coffeeshop, starts playing loud music. That's when he sees this guy with fancy sunglasses, skinny jeans, and a top hat walks in. He sees the rust programmer's confusion, and loudly announces to everyone:

"The lights are running javascript, and so is the TV. We love inconsistencies, confusion, and complexity. Yet we make millions of dollars working at big companies." 

The Rust programmer looks at the javascript programmer in disappointed eyes. Right before leaving the coffeeshop, he says to the Javascript programmer, "Bro, try Rust."

What I would love to do is take some of that pain and discomfort and make it a little more enjoyable. When I was writing that song, I was really just trying to make something that would be interesting enough to talk about. I wanted to say, "I'm not going to be the person who kills a little girl and then impales her head on a fence post. I'm not that person." I wanted to say, "I'm not going to be the person who goes out and kills a little girl and then impales her head on a fence post. I'm not that person."

But then I found that that's not who I am. I'm not that person, and I don't want to be. I thought that people would be able to relate to that.

And then the idea of the big garden came about. I think gardening in general is really a great analogy for the way we interact with each other. I mean, I know that sounds really weird. I mean, I have a real appreciation for the way that we interact with each other. I wish that I could do things that were more peaceful and less violent, but I don't know how to.

I like gardening in general because it's a lot of work. It's a lot of hard labor, and it's a lot of sweat. I think that when we're not literally doing the work, but we're working on a relationship, that's where the problem starts.

It's also a real metaphor for the way that we get things done. The way that we get things done is with a lot of work, sweat, and effort. I think that's a really good way to think about it.

I think about gardening all the time. I think about working my garden. I think about how my garden is going to grow and how my garden is going to look in a month. label:
The Balfour Declaration was a public statement issued by the British government in 1917 during World War I. The declaration stated the British government's support for the establishment of a "national home for the Jewish people" in Palestine. The statement was addressed to Baron Rothschild, a prominent leader of the British Jewish community, and was later incorporated into the League of Nations' mandate for Palestine.

The Balfour Declaration was seen as a major milestone in the Zionist movement, which sought to establish a Jewish state in Palestine. The declaration was also significant because it represented a shift in British policy towards the region. Prior to the declaration, the British government had issued conflicting statements about its intentions in Palestine, and had made promises to both the Arabs and the Jews.

The declaration was not without controversy, however. Critics argued that it violated the rights of the Arab population in Palestine, who constituted a majority of the population at the time. The declaration also contributed to tensions between Jewish and Arab communities in Palestine, which would eventually escalate into the Arab-Israeli conflict.

label:
In computing, DLL stands for "Dynamic Link Library". It is a file format used on Microsoft Windows operating systems to store code and data that can be shared by multiple programs at the same time.

A DLL file contains compiled code that can be called by a program to perform a particular function or set of functions. The use of DLLs allows programs to be modular and more easily maintainable, as changes to a DLL can be made without requiring changes to all the programs that use it.

DLL files can contain a wide variety of code and data, from simple utility functions to entire graphical user interfaces. Common DLLs include those that provide access to hardware devices, perform cryptographic operations, or provide network connectivity.

When a program needs to use a DLL, it loads the DLL into memory and calls the appropriate functions in the DLL to perform the desired tasks. This makes the program smaller and faster, as it does not need to include all the code necessary to perform every possible function.

input: What is the Balfour Declaration?
output:
ats to the Balfour Declaration was a declaration by the British government, in response to the Balfour Declaration, and the statement of the Zionist Organization of America. According to the Declaration, the British government recognized the historical and national rights of the Jewish people to a national home in Palestine and pledged their support for the development of that country. It was also a means by which the Zionists hoped to obtain the aid of the United States in their struggle for the establishment of a Jewish commonwealth in the Land of Israel. This declaration paved the way for the establishment of the State of Israel in 1948.

Balfour Declaration, 1917.

British Colonial Secretary Joseph Chamberlain announced the declaration: The British Government have decided that it is desirable that the Government of the Mandatory Power should encourage Jewish immigration to Palestine to the extent of their financial ability and that the Jewish Agency be given full powers of managing the immigration of Jews to Palestine. The Jewish Agency will be a government in embryo; it will be given self-governing authority for a limited period, but not self-government for a long time to come. What
label:
A DLL, or Dynamic Link Library, is a type of file used in Microsoft Windows operating systems to store shared code and data that can be used by multiple programs simultaneously. DLLs help reduce the duplication of code, save memory, and allow for easier updates of shared components.

When a program uses a function or resource from a DLL, it doesn't have to include the entire code or data within its own executable file. Instead, the program dynamically links to the DLL at runtime, which means the code or data is only loaded into memory when it's actually needed. This dynamic linking process allows multiple programs to share the same code or data, reducing the overall memory footprint and improving the efficiency of the system.

DLLs can be created by developers to provide functionality that can be reused by different programs or to modularize their own applications. They are also used extensively by the operating system itself to provide core functionality, such as user interface components, file handling, and network communication.

Although DLLs offer many advantages, they can also lead to issues known as "DLL Hell," which occurs when multiple versions of the same DLL are installed on a system, causing conflicts and compatibility issues. Modern operating systems have implemented various mechanisms, such

PayPal.com or other major credit cards are accepted.

For non-PayPal customers, your payment may take up to 30 days.

SECURITY:

All funds are held in a secure and FDIC insured bank account.

Your credit card number is never stored.

CANCELLATION POLICY:

If you cancel or reschedule your lessons within the first 60 days, you will not be charged and your entire lesson deposit will be refunded.

If you cancel or reschedule your lessons after 60 days, your entire deposit will be refunded, minus your lesson deposit (which is non-refundable).

If you do not cancel or reschedule your lessons, your deposit will be non-refundable.

If you cancel or reschedule your lessons 90 days or more in arrears, your entire deposit will be refunded, minus your lesson deposit (which is non-refundable).

If you cancel or reschedule your lessons beyond 90 days in arrears, your lesson deposit will be returned.

If a customer has already paid a deposit, then the entire deposit will be refunded, minus the deposit that was paid.

input: what does the @ in python do

ing

A:

@ is an operator.  It tells python to substitute one value (the one after the @) into another.  The @ in your example means "find all occurrences of this string between the two characters and replace them with this one".
In your example, @ is used to replace the @ character with a "1".  So in your example, that would be:

"foo@bar" => "foo1@bar"
"foo@bar" => "foo@1bar"
"foo@bar" => "foo bar"

The @ in your example is just a placeholder.  The real value will be substituted later by Python.

Python provides a nice way to refer to the enclosing namespace (namespace of the current file):
>>> import sys
>>> def func():
...     pass
...
>>> sys.modules['__main__'].func
<function func>

>>> sys.modules['__main__'].func()
<function func at 0x5b6b80>

This will continue to work even when the code is not in a module.
If you want to inspect the namespace of the caller (from the current module), and possibly change it, you can use the inspect module:
>>> import inspect
>>> inspect.getcallers(func)
[<function func at 0x5b6b80>]
>>> inspect.getcallers(inspect.currentframe().f_back)
[<function func at 0x5b6b80>]

If you want to look at the namespace of a function created from a string, you can use the dis module:
>>> import dis

a request to showcase your work?

For the most part, there are no guidelines to follow. The request
should just be a humble request showing the passion for the work,
and the desire to make it better.

It is certainly a good idea to make the request a little bit
more specific, especially if the request is for a collaboration.
For example, if you are requesting a collaboration, you should
provide the other person with the task specifications, and

desired output.

the work, and who the other person is.

input: Will AI assistants replace human workers?
output:
's CEO Gordon Bell argues that such a thing is years away. "Robots are a lot more complicated than you're imagining," he says. "There are a lot of different ways that robots could be used."

The tradeoff: Replacing workers means additional costs. "It's going to take a lot of work to get to a point where you can say, 'OK, we have a human being, a human being that has to do this job for $5 an hour,'" says Bell. "That's not quite to the point where you can say, 'OK, we have a robot that can do that job for $5 an hour.'"

A robot can replace a worker, but it can't replace a human being

The firm's researchers are working on a task that's potentially even more complex: They're working on a robot that can "learn" and adapt to a human being's actions. "It's a very complicated thing to get that right, but in a lot of cases, at that point, it's just a matter of development time," says Bell. "It's not that the robot can't do it, it's that you're going to have to develop the robot to do it."

That makes Bell skeptical of the notion that robots will usurp a human worker's job. It's not so much that the robot will have to have the skills of a human worker, but that the robot will have to have human-like characteristics, such as empathy. "It's not going to be a robot that's like a human that's just like a human," says Bell. "It'll be a robot that has a human-like intelligence."

That point is also made by Nick Bostrom, an AI research fellow who works at Oxford University's Future of Humanity Institute. "The idea that a robot has to have human-like intelligence is not really a realistic idea," he says. "The more realistic idea is that a robot has the ability to have a human-like intelligence and be able to learn how to behave like a human being."

The tradeoff: A human worker will have more job security. In a world where robots replace humans, "at some point, there will be a lot more pressure on the people that are left," says Bostrom. "There will be a lot more pressure for them to get rehired."

In the workplace, the human race is already in a race against the clock

input: Why do we need AI assistants?
output:
This is the first of a series of articles looking at the future of AI and how it will impact workplaces.Ask the experts, and get your questions answered!

We recently caught up with a few of the entrepreneurs and investors behind the Australasian AI Technology Series. Here, they share their thoughts on what’s next for AI as the tech sector continues to evolve.

What do you think will be the biggest impact of AI on the workplace?

Robby: I think AI will have a big impact on the workplace. There’s likely to be a lot of automation in the near future, so we’re going to see a lot of automation taking over the workforce. And so we’ll see it going somewhere from here.

Stephen: Robby, what do you think will be the biggest impact of AI on the workplace?

Robby: I think a lot of the work that people do is repetitive. And I’ve been working for six years now and I have never done anything that could even be considered repetitive. So if you’re going to be doing something that would be repetitive, you might as well be doing it with AI because it’s going to save you time.

I’ve been working in sales for a few years now and I’m in a team that has a lot of internal interaction. I’ve spoken to people who have used AI assistants before, and they’ve told me they’ve used them a lot. I haven’t really used it, myself, but I’ve been told that it’s a very helpful tool. So I think it’s going to be a lot of times where people just don’t need to be talking to people. They don’t need to be talking to a person. input: Why do we need AI assistants?
output:
I read about the fact that most of the time AI does not even understand what
it's doing. If you need something that can think you can use a human.

------
jedberg
I think the author may be overstating the case. The problem with bots isn't
that they can't do things, it's that they can't tell the difference between
what they should do and what they will do.

I have a couple of bots that are really bad at things. They are essentially
trained on the wrong thing. They know that "go to work" is wrong, but they go
to work every day.

What I want is a bot that will tell me "not at work right now" or "do not
work."

My bots can do this, but they only do it if I have told them (through a
command line interface) what to do.

I'm not sure the author has an AI assistant yet.

~~~
tostitos1979
>My bots can do this, but they only do it if I have told them (through a
command line interface) what to do.

That's what you want. But I would also argue that this is the _opposite_ of
"just do it".

Start with a basic task, then if you are satisfied, move on to more complex
tasks.

------
zby
I don't see the question at the end of the article. It's more like: "Can a
random bot help me solve my problem?"

I doubt. The problem is that any general AI is difficult to build, so even if
it is possible to build an AI that can't solve your problem, it is not
possible to build an AI that can solve your problem and help you in your
decision process.

The other problem is that if you build an AI that can't solve your problem,
and even if it is a real AI, it can only help you in the decision process, but
not in solving the problem.

------
DINKDINK
Just because it can't do something does not mean it can't do something.

For example:

\- A robot can't do calculus, but I know someone who can do calculus

\- A robot can't write a book, but I know several people who can write books

\- A robot

input: Why do we need AI assistants?
output:
:

2019-06-02T06:33:58+00:00

Why do we need AI assistants?

https://www.dailymotion.com/video/x4n4u2q?utm_source=SangomaApp&utm_medium=social&utm_campaign=V3_C2C_DEMO_#

In a recent interview with Fierce Mobile Marketing, the Head of Product at Sangoma, Sergio D'Ostilio, explained his thoughts regarding the use of AI assistants, why they are needed, and how they are a core part of his company’s success.

“I think that we will see AI assistants becoming a part of many more devices in the future,” he said. “For example, if you ask a taxi driver to drive you to your destination, they’ll know you want to go to a specific location, but they won’t know where that is.

“Our company’s success is based on the fact that we have the most accurate location information on the earth. We have a lot of advantages over other companies and we’re proud of it, but we need to make it even better. That’s why we’ve built an AI system to help guide our drivers, so that they can do their job more efficiently.

“We think that AI assistants will be a fundamental part of our success in the future,” D’Ostilio continued. “They should be able to help us with a lot of things, but they should also be able to help us with everything. If we can use AI assistants to actually try and solve the world’s problems, we can be proud of that, too.”

D’Ostilio is confident that Sangoma’s latest product, the Sangoma City A.I.D., will help the company reach those goals.

“We think that AI assistants will become an integral part of our company’s success in the future,” he said. “We aspire to be a company that will be the best at understanding people’s needs and adjusting our product accordingly.”

label:
Building a PC can be a rewarding experience, but it requires some technical knowledge and patience. Here are the general steps you can follow:

1. Determine your budget and what you want to use the PC for (gaming, work, etc.). This will help you choose the appropriate components.

2. Choose the components you want to use (CPU, motherboard, RAM, storage, GPU, power supply, case, and peripherals).

3. Make sure all the components are compatible with each other. Check the manufacturer's website and online forums for compatibility information.

4. Gather the necessary tools (screwdriver, thermal paste, etc.).

5. Install the CPU onto the motherboard, following the manufacturer's instructions.

6. Install the RAM onto the motherboard, following the manufacturer's instructions.

7. Install the storage (hard drive or solid-state drive) onto the motherboard or into the case, following the manufacturer's instructions.

8. Install the power supply into the case, following the manufacturer's instructions.

9. Install the GPU onto the motherboard, following the manufacturer's instructions.

10. Connect all

label:
Building a computer 
Pros:
* Cheaper in the long run
* Easier to fix
* Better overall quality

Cons:
* Can be more expensive upfront
* Higher chance of user error
* You need to figure out part compatibility

---

Off-the-Shelf computer
Pros:
* Faster to buy than to build
* Plug and Play
* Normally Cheaper to buy rather than build

Cons:
* Repairs are harder to do
* Build Quality can be lower
* Limited configuration available

There are plenty of other reasons that can influence your decisions but it comes down to how soon you need a computer, and how confident you are working on a computer.

Dear Cube,

How do I build a PC?

I want to build a PC.

I have a laptop and a desktop. I've got a ton of games on my PC. I want to build a computer to play my games.

My question is, how do I build a computer?

Thank you.

My Answer

Build the computer you want in the way you want.

You can choose to build a PC, laptop, or even a desktop. Here are some suggestions:

Build a PC that is less powerful than your existing PC. You can make a PC that is less powerful than your existing PC by choosing a lower end CPU (such as a Pentium 4, Intel Celeron, or a low-end AMD Athlon) and a lower end motherboard (such as an Intel Celeron, Intel Pentium, or an AMD Athlon).

Build a PC that is less powerful than your existing PC but more powerful than your existing PC. You can make a PC that is less powerful than your existing PC by choosing a lower end CPU (such as a Pentium 4, Intel Celeron, or a low-end AMD Athlon) and a higher end motherboard (such as a Pentium 4, Intel Celeron, or an AMD Athlon).

Build a PC that is less powerful than your existing PC and more powerful than your existing PC. You can make a PC that is less powerful than your existing PC by choosing a lower end CPU (such as a Pentium 4, Intel Celeron, or a low-end AMD Athlon) and a higher end motherboard (such as a Pentium 4, Intel Celeron, or an AMD Athlon).

Build a PC that is more powerful than your existing PC. You can make a PC that is more powerful than your existing PC by choosing a higher end CPU (such as an Intel Pentium 4, Intel Celeron, or an AMD Athlon) and a higher end motherboard (such as an Intel Pentium 4, Intel Celeron, or an AMD Athlon).
